thread.title: Andrew Marr silences Shami Chakrabarti for not accepting Labour issues | Politics | News | Express.co.uk
thread.title_full: Andrew Marr silences Shami Chakrabarti for not accepting Labour issues | Politics | News | Express.co.uk

author: Darren Hunt
title: Andrew Marr silences Shami Chakrabarti for not accepting Labour issues | Politics | News | Express.co.uk
text:
Some people who say that you are all frankly distanced from reality Andrew Marr 
“I think the party is in listening mode, but it won’t be able to put that listening into practice unless it unites.” 
Marr also clashed with Ms Chakrabarti as the Labour politician attempted to blame The Andrew Marr Show for bias in the lead up to the Copeland and Stoke-on-Trent Central by-election’s. 
She said: “Even on your program last week a few days before a by-election on two Brexit seats, there wasn’t a single person on your program speaking for the leadership.” 
Marr snapped back arguing that there was a well represented Labour MP in the paper review. Corbyn looks crushed following by-election defeat Fri, February 24, 2017 Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn leaves his home following a humiliating blow by the Conservatives after snatching Copeland in a by-election victory. The struggling politician was talking on the day his party lost a by-election to the government, the first time this has happened in over 30 years. Adam Gray / SWNS.com 1 of 10 Jeremy Corbyn is seen at Savoy Place in London where the Labour leader was giving a speech on Brexit 
Ms Chakrabarti cut the host off again insisting it wasn’t a fair balance as Lord Mandelson was on the show, who is publicly against Mr Corbyn. 
Fuming, Marr finished the Labour MP attacking her over her claim. 
“Yeah, we are allowed to have Lord Mandelson,” he said. “Lord Mandelson and Tony Blair who’s also criticised for this, under that terrible regime Labour won Copeland by massive majorities time and time again.” Related articles
